instructions:
MEAT PREPARATION
1 1/2 to 2 lb boneless chuck, cross rib or top round
1/4 cup flour
2 tsp salt
2 tbsp vegetable oil
2 tbsp margarine
1 cup red wine
1 can *(10 oz)* Campbell's beef broth
1 can *(15 oz)* Swanson's beef broth
1/2 tsp thyme
1 bay leaf

Cut beef into 3/4 inch cubes and pat dry with paper towels. Roll half of meat in mixture of flour and salt
in a shallow dish. Heat half of oil and margarine in Dutch oven over medium high heat until very hot but not
smoking. Add beef without crowding and turn until dark brown and crusty on all sides. Remove with slotted
spoon and repeat with remaining meat. Deglaze with wine, scraping bottom to loosen all browned bits; boil
about 2 minutes. Return meat, add broth and 1 cup of reserved vegetable liquid. Add thyme and bay leaf;
reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until tender.

STEW PREPARATION
2 medium onions, peeled, quartered and separated
1 can *(4 oz)* mushrooms, drained
2 cloves garlic, mashed
2 tsp McCormick stew seasoning mix
1/4 tsp pepper, or to taste
2 envelopes McCormick brown gravy mix
3/8 cup flour mixed with 1/2 cup vegetable liquid
Salt to taste
Remove meat with slotted spoon to vegetable pot. Dissolve and mix 2 packages of gravy mix with 1/2
cup of vegetable liquid, add to Dutch oven and bring to boil. Add sufficient mixture of the flour and
vegetable liquid and cook to thicken. Add pepper, garlic, Stew Seasoning and salt. Return meat and
vegetables, add onions and mushrooms and simmer covered for 1/2 hour. 
*(Rev. 4/24/00)*
ingredients: 4 large potatoes, each cut in 6 pieces
1 envelope G Washington Brown seasoning mix
In a 4-quart pot add the above ingredients with water to cover the vegetables; cook 15 minutes. Drain
name: Beef Stew
creator: Mary & Jim Decker
